data.q: Which of the following is the correct way to create an array in JavaScript?
data.explanation: Using square brackets `[]` is the most common and preferred way to create an array.

data.q: How do you access the first element of an array `arr`?
data.explanation: Array indices start at 0, so the first element is accessed with `arr[0]`.

data.q: Which method adds one or more elements to the end of an array?
data.explanation: `push()` appends elements to the end of an array.

data.q: Which method removes the last element from an array?
data.explanation: `pop()` removes and returns the last element of an array.

data.q: Which method creates a new array without modifying the original?
data.explanation: `slice()` returns a shallow copy of a portion of an array without mutating it.

data.q: Which array method is used to transform each element and return a new array?
data.explanation: `map()` applies a function to each element and returns a new array.

data.q: Which array method is used to filter elements based on a condition?
data.explanation: `filter()` returns a new array containing only elements that satisfy the condition.

data.q: Which array method reduces an array to a single value?
data.explanation: `reduce()` accumulates array values into a single result.

data.q: Which JavaScript collection allows unique values only?
data.explanation: `Set` stores only unique values and automatically removes duplicates.

data.q: Which collection stores key-value pairs and preserves insertion order?
data.explanation: `Map` stores key-value pairs and remembers the original insertion order of keys.
